title: correct voicing of secondary leading tone

content.question: In measure 2 of the example above, a secondary leading-tone seventh chord needs to be filled in on beat 2. Which of the following is the best choice?

choices.label: The figure presents a stack of four quarter notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are G3 and E4. The treble clef pitches are B-flat 4 and C-sharp 5.
The figure presents a stack of four quarter notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are G3 and B-flat 3. The treble clef pitches are C-sharp 5 and E5.
The figure presents a stack of four quarter notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are C-sharp 3 and G3. The treble clef pitches are E4 and B-flat 4.
The figure presents a stack of four quarter notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are E3 and C-sharp 4. The treble clef pitches are G4 and B-flat 4.

content.answer: The figure presents a stack of four quarter notes on a grand staff. The bass clef pitches are E3 and C-sharp 4. The treble clef pitches are G4 and B-flat 4.

unit.text: 7: Harmony and Voice Leading IV - Secondary Function

topic.text: 7.4: Part Writing of Secondary Leading Tone Chords

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
